Posts.Content: Thanks all. Things really cleared during the day.
Posts.Title: Post Surgery; blood in urine.

Posts.Content: I am now about 30 hours after robotic surgery. All went well except the dr had to remove so much urethra he almost didn't have enough left to reconnect. My question is that today I am seeing more blood in my urine then I did when I was in the hospital. Is this normal? It's not a ton, just enough to give a slight red tinge to my urine.
Posts.Title: Post Surgery; blood in urine.

Posts.Content: I am 48 and having surgery tomorrow. Are there others here under 50 who have chosen different therapies then removal? My doctor said 48 is younger than normal for PC. I would love to here comments and progress of others who have had PC in their 40's. I had a PSA of 26 and my biopsy showed 7 out of 14 sections with cancer. Gleason score of 7.
Posts.Title: New Here. Di Vinci surgery at noon tomorrow. Have a question for "young" patients.
